connectorDescriptor.description: A powerful application security tool that expertly pinpoints vulnerabilities such as SQL Injection and XSS using Contrast's award-winning instrumentation approach.
connectorDescriptor.name: Contrast for Eclipse

overview.summary: Contrast for Eclipse enables developers to quickly and efficiently create secure code free of OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities. It brings Contrastâ€™s award winning application security technology to Java developers via a fully integrated Eclipse Java IDE experience. Contrast for Eclipse not only speeds vulnerability remediation, it enables application security pros and developers to work together to reduce risk.

connectorDescriptor.description: EGit for integration with the Git version control system.
connectorDescriptor.name: EGit

connectorDescriptor.description: EclEmma is a free Java code coverage tool for Eclipse based on the great EMMA Java code coverage tool.
connectorDescriptor.name: EclEmma

connectorDescriptor.description: A static analysis tool to find bugs in Java programs.
connectorDescriptor.name: FindBugs

overview.summary: FindBugs - Find Bugs in Java Programs

connectorDescriptor.description: PMD is a Java source code analyzer. It finds unused variables, empty catch blocks, unnecessary object creation, and so forth.
connectorDescriptor.name: PMD

connectorDescriptor.description: The purpose of the Groovy-Eclipse plugin is to promote the Groovy platform and ecosystem as a viable and productive development environment for Java developers.
connectorDescriptor.name: Groovy-Eclipse

overview.summary: The purpose of the Groovy-Eclipse plugin is to promote the Groovy platform and ecosystem as a viable and productive development environment for Java developers working in the Eclipse SDK.

connectorDescriptor.description: This feature provides the Groovy 2.2 compiler for Groovy-Eclipse. Once installed, the 2.2 compiler becomes the default for the workspace. And other compilers can be uses through the system preferences.
connectorDescriptor.name: Groovy 2.2 Compiler for Groovy-Eclipse

overview.summary: The Groovy 2.2 compiler provides a static compilation mode for Groovy and many other features. However, it is not compatible with the most recent version of Grails 2.x.

connectorDescriptor.description: This feature provides the Groovy 2.3 compiler for Groovy-Eclipse. Once installed, the 2.3 compiler becomes the default for the workspace. And other compilers can be uses through the system preferences.
connectorDescriptor.name: Groovy 2.3 Compiler for Groovy-Eclipse

overview.summary: The Groovy 2.3 compiler provides a static compilation mode for Groovy and many other features. However, it is not compatible with the most recent version of Grails 2.x.

connectorDescriptor.description: This feature provides the Groovy 2.4 compiler for Groovy-Eclipse. Once installed, the 2.4 compiler becomes the default for the workspace. And other compilers can be uses through the system preferences.
connectorDescriptor.name: Groovy 2.4 Compiler for Groovy-Eclipse

overview.summary: The Groovy 2.4 compiler provides a static compilation mode for Groovy and many other features. However, it is not compatible with the most recent version of Grails 2.x.

connectorDescriptor.description: This feature provides integration between Groovy-Eclipse and M2Eclipse. Only install this feature if you are using Groovy and Maven inside of STS
connectorDescriptor.name: Groovy-Eclipse Configurator for M2Eclipse

overview.summary: This feature provides the Groovy-Eclipse configurator for M2Eclipse

connectorDescriptor.description: Spring Roo is a next-generation rapid application development tool for Java developers. With Roo you can easily build full Java applications in minutes.

connectorDescriptor.description: Eclipse Data Tools, including a collection to database connectors to quickly access your data sources from within the IDE
connectorDescriptor.name: Eclipse Data Tools

overview.summary: The Eclipse Data Tools Platform provides extensible frameworks and exemplary tools, enabling a diverse set of plug-in offerings specific to particular data-centric technologies and supported by the DTP ecosystem.

connectorDescriptor.description: Infinitest is a continuous test runner for JUnit tests. Whenever you change a class, Infinitest runs your tests for you. Itâ€™s smart about what tests to run.
connectorDescriptor.name: Infinitest

overview.summary: Infinitest is a continuous test runner for JUnit tests. Whenever you change a class, Infinitest runs your tests for you. Itâ€™s smart about what tests to run, and only runs the ones you need. It reports test errors in the same way Eclipse reports compile errors, and provides additional information that helps you write better tests.

connectorDescriptor.description: The Google Plugin for Eclipse is the fastest way to start developing Google Web Toolkit and App Engine applications.
connectorDescriptor.name: Google Plugin for Eclipse

connectorDescriptor.description: DataNucleus provides its own plugin for use within Eclipse, giving access to many features of DataNucleus from the convenience of your development environment.
connectorDescriptor.name: DataNucleus Eclipse Plugin
